before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"de10o","text":"Clean the bench surfaces and pipettes using RNase ZAP to inhibit all RNases.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9cb73","text":"Always use RNase free centrifuge tubes, PCR tubes and pipette tips for all steps wherever required.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"aa8ol","text":"Identifying RNA modifications across the transcriptome has been made possible by direct RNA sequencing using nanopore sequencing from Oxford Nanopore Technologies. This is due to voltage changes happening when each nucleotide passes through the pore. Hypothesis is that since each nucleotide passing through the pore has a distinct change in voltage, nucleotides with epigenetic modifications (e.g.methylation) also has distinct voltage changes when passing through. This is identified by errors in basecalling.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7an1p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"vepd","text":"Several software have been developed to identify locations of modifications using machine learning, deep learning models. In order to make highly accurate predictions, there is the necessity of comparing the signals from native RNA sequencing with RNA without any modifications. A few recent research publications get RNA through in vitro transcription but only for ribosomal RNAs (rRNA). This is easier since there are only 7 different ribosomal RNAs for each type i.e., 16S, 23S and 5S. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":330,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbevl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6tcn9","text":"Getting IVT RNA for entire transcriptome is not trivial since bacterial transcriptome is complex and depends on the condition the bacteria has been grown in. We use the method of strand switching during cDNA synthesis to get cDNA for whole bacterial transcriptome which can then be used as a template for IVT.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"bmacm","text":"Great precautions should be taken when handling RNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: in vitro transcription,direct RNA sequencing,RNA modifications
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"8aoo3","text":"HiScribe™ T7 Quick High Yield RNA Synthesis Kit - E2050S","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eavt2","text":"RNA Clean \u0026 Concentrator-5 - R1013","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9fm7","text":"RNaseOUT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6m4cm","text":"Primers: oligo-d(T)-22 primer, T7-Strand Switch Primer, PR2/T7 promoter primer (primer sequences commented in the protocol)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4npdo","text":"10 mM dNTP solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b18os","text":"Nuclease-free water (Thermofisher - #AM9937)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ctnt9","text":"0.2 mL thin-walled PCR tubes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7dc6r","text":"1.5 mL Eppendorf LoBind tubes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6evlm","text":"Maxima H Minus Reverse Transcriptase (200 U/uL) with 5x RT buffer (Thermofisher - #EP0751)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3r3r","text":"Pre-chilled freezer block at -20 C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hsh9","text":"LongAmp Taq 2X MasterMix (NEB - #M0287)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"buvit","text":"RNase Cocktail Enzyme Mix (Thermofisher - #AM2286)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9i0n","text":"RNAclean Agencourt XP beads","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cnsld","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eo8f9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
